intro: Willoughbya pachylepis, commonly known as the Christmas bell, is a striking tropical plant native to Madagascar. It is characterized by its large, showy, bell-shaped flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. The plant features thick, waxy leaves that help it retain moisture in its arid native habitat. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. Willoughbya pachylepis is often cultivated for its ornamental value and unique floral display.
